Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Tameret with a blue lappet wig, a brown face with the eyes traced in black, a yellow and red collar edged with black strokes, brown hands in relief holding two red hoes, the body is white, the legs are inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground bordered with red lines.
Condition: fair - face worn, one side damaged
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Gardner Wilkinson
